Test Math

04 Feb 2017

Let’s test some inline math $x$, $y$, $x_1$, $y_1$.

Now a inline math with special character:

Test a display math: Is it O.K.1?

Test a display math with equation number: \begin{equation} |\psi_1\rangle = a|0\rangle + b|1\rangle \end{equation} Is it O.K.2?

Test a display math with equation number: Is it O.K.3?

And test a display math without equaltion number:

Is it O.K.4?

Test a display math with equation number:

\begin{align} |\psi_1\rangle &= a|0\rangle + b|1\rangle \\
|\psi_2\rangle &= c|0\rangle + d|1\rangle \end{align}

Is it O.K.5?

And test a display math without equaltion number: \begin{align*} |\psi_1\rangle &= a|0\rangle + b|1\rangle \\
|\psi_2\rangle &= c|0\rangle + d|1\rangle \end{align*} Is it O.K.6?
